ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1 = Not reporting a serious AE within 24 hours of learning about it; 2 = Reportable safety events not reported to IRB; 97 = Other (Please specify in comment box)

1 = Failure to obtain informed consent; 2 = Consent form used was not ; 3 = Consent form does not include updates ; 4 = Consent form missing; 5 = Consent form not signed and dated by ; 6 = Consent form does not contain all required signatures; 97 = Other (Please specify in comment box)
1 = Randomization of an ineligible child; 2 = Treatment before baseline assessment; 3 = Prohibited concomitant medication; 97 = Other: Please specify in comments

1 = Randomization into wrong treatment; 2 = Use of unallowable concomitant treatments; 3 = Different caregiver informant; 4 = Equipment Failure; 5 = Child not feeling well; 6 = Child's noncompliance; 7 = Time constraints; 8 = Incorrect duration of tasks; 9 = Amplifier switched from randomization assignment; 10 = Bonus points given to child due to failed; 97 = Other (Please specify in comment box)

ElementDescription: Description of other issues during protocol
Was this PDE reported to the IRB
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data

Notes: 1= subject; 2= parent; 3= clinician; 4= teacher; 5= trainer; 6= fidelity reviewer
